title: ‘I offered to pay my dead brother in law’s secret debt – then it trebled to £9k’
text:
Has a company treated you unfairly? Our consumer champion, Katie Morley, is here to help. For how to contact her click here.

Dear Katie,

My brother-in-law was recently found dead after the police were asked to break into his property. He was 68, single and living alone.

Several days after his death my wife and I discovered he had secret debts. He suffered from depression and he’d got himself into a spending spiral, racking up credit card debt over a number of years.

We found a letter from a company called Cabot Financial saying he owed it £9,490, but that it was prepared to accept £2,847 within 14 days to clear the account. Only six days had passed since the date on the letter.
